# Laravel Test to send multiple emails Asynchronously over API

## Prerequisite
* Install Composer
* Ensure that PHP is installed
* Install Redis on your operating system


Also, this demo application uses Mailtrap.io as a mail provider. Kindly create an account an update the appropriate credentials in the `.env` file.


## Getting Started

Download or clone the project [here on GitHub](https://github.com/yemiwebby/laravel-vanilla-api.git).

```bash
git clone https://github.com/yemiwebby/laravel-vanilla-api.git
```

Navigate into the project and Run the following command to install all the required dependencies:

```bash
composer install
```

Create `.env` file

```bash
cp .env.example .env
```

Next, open `.env` file and replace the mailtrap credentials with your own as obtained from mailtrap.io dashboard.

### Start the application

```bash
php artisan serve
```

Also open another terminal from root project and start Laravel queue to send mails asynchronously with the following command:

```bash
php artisan queue:work
```

## Testing the endpoints

Open up POSTMAN or any preferable API testing tool and use the data below as JSON body:

```json
    [
        {
            "from": "Olususi Oluyemi <yemiwebby@mg.yemiwebby.com.ng>",
            "to": "yemiwebby@gmail.com",
            "subject": "Subject 1",
            "body": "I just want to be sure that this is working professionally fine",
            "attachments": [
                {
                    "base64": "data:image/jpeg;base64,",
                    "filetype": "image/jpeg", 
                    "filename": "oluyemi.jpeg"
                }
            ]
        },
        {
            "from": "Olususi Oluyemi <yemiwebby@mg.yemiwebby.com.ng>",
            "to": "kayoluyem23@gmail.com",
            "subject": "This is from me to you",
            "body": "I just want to be sure that this is working professionally fine",
            "attachments": [
                {
                    "base64": "data:image/jpeg;base64,",
                    "filetype": "image/jpeg", 
                    "filename": "oluyemi.jpeg"
                }
            ]
        },
        {
            "from": "Olususi Oluyemi <yemiwebby@mg.yemiwebby.com.ng>",
            "to": "codezyemmy@gmail.com",
            "subject": "This is from me to you",
            "body": "I just want to be sure that this is working professionally fine",
            "attachments": [
                {
                    "base64": "data:image/jpeg;base64,",
                    "filetype": "image/jpeg", 
                    "filename": "oluyemi.jpeg"
                },
                {
                    "base64": "data:image/jpeg;base64,",
                    "filetype": "image/jpeg", 
                    "filename": "oluyemi.jpeg"
                }
            ]
        },
        {
            "from": "Joseph Oluyemi <jo@mg.yemiwebby.com.ng>",
            "to": "yemiwebby@gmail.com",
            "subject": "This is from me to you",
            "body": "I just want to be sure that this is working professionally fine"
        },
        {
            "from": "Andre Olususi <dre@mg.yemiwebby.com.ng>",
            "to": "yemiwebby@gmail.com",
            "subject": "This is from me to you",
            "body": "I just want to be sure that this is working professionally fine"
        },
        {
            "from": "Funmilayo Oluyemi <funmi@mg.yemiwebby.com.ng>",
            "to": "configyemi@gmail.com",
            "subject": "This is from me to you",
            "body": "I just want to be sure that this is working professionally fine"
        }
    ]
```

The snippet above contains array of data (email) with base64 attachments included.
